Text.Value: Yes, return to the Fugue Plane.
On second thoughts - it can stay.
A single mortal soul... tossed as the errant coin. So it shall be.
On second thoughts - stay.
Leave.
Why are you talking like that?
These souls clawed their way back from the Fugue Plane for vengeance.
Wait for me in my camp.
I have no more use of you.
This soul remembers its invective, but remembers not its tongue.
Art thou certain?
*Though spoken with a different voice, you recognise the eloquent drawl of Withers, the wraith that summoned the hireling.*
This vessel's service lies with those of great import. Thou art not.
Let's get back to work.
They are but echoes, they recall not a manner of speech - thus I lent them my rhetoric.
Because you needed to speak to it. Because it feels... correct. Fitting.
Return this vessel to my camp, Withers.
To speak thusly takes little of my effort. Besides, what better use is there of time than discourse?
Thou art the master - so it shall be.
This vessel is at thy disposal. Do what thou wilt.
Why do the hirelings need to speak?
Follow me.
As long as the soul remembers how to fight - that's what matters.
Yes, return it to the Fugue Plane.
This soul awaits thy command.
The art of violence is one memory not lost to them - I assure you. Now, let us return to the fray.
I'm surprised you've nothing better to do, Withers.
Better get back to it, then.
I have no more use of this hireling.
I have other matters to ask of this hireling.
